meanings.definition: The quality or state of being lazy or idle.
meanings.sent1: His sluggardnesses were evident as he lounged on the couch all day.
meanings.sent2: The sluggardnesses of the cat were apparent as it slept in the sun.
meanings.sent3: Even the ants were laughing at the sluggardnesses of the snail.
meanings.sent4: Her sluggardnesses were like a heavy cloak, weighing her down.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's patience was tested by the student's sluggardnesses.

meanings.definition: The act of being slow or sluggish in movement or action.
meanings.sent1: The sluggardnesses of the turtle made it fall behind in the race.
meanings.sent2: We couldn't afford any sluggardnesses in our delivery schedule.
meanings.sent3: The sluggardnesses of the old car made it struggle up the hill.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to move with sluggardnesses as we waited for the bus.
meanings.sent5: The sluggardnesses of the sloth were a source of amusement for the zoo visitors.
